result.execSummary:
The defendant Leander Jovon Gregg #573351 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leander Jovon Gregg #573351 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leander Jovon Gregg #573351 was found guilty of Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Leander Jovon Gregg #573351 was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Leander Jovon Gregg #573351 was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:12 PM Defendant Leander Jovon Gregg in Court with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Walker notes sentencing on Deferred Agreement, revoked on 10/10/19.  Recites facts of case, history of Defendant, notes victim consideration.  State recommending maximum sentence of 1.5 years in prison, 2 years ES.  $518 court costs.  Victim's father makes statement.  Atty. Nelson states position, notes reasoning for various continuances.  Defendant makes statement.  Court questions Defendant.  Court sentences Defendant.  3 1/2 years in Prison (1.5 years Incarceration, 2 years extended supervision), Imposed and Stayed.  Court orders 3 years Probation, specific conditions to be set by Agent.  Court states treatment issues need to be addressed.  -90 days conditional Jail time.  Defendant may serve in Eau Claire if it is at no cost to Pierce County.  If Defendant serves in Eau Claire, work release is granted.  If Defendant serves in Pierce County it is straight time.  Court orders report date w/in 30 days.  By  01/05/2020.  DA requests direct report, Court reiterates he is granting him time to report.  -$518 court costs.  Court advises of appeal rights.   

518

Atty Nelson: objects to warrant as DOC made the decision to put him in a treatment facility and it could effect his treatment. Atty Walker responds. Court: decision was made by his DOC agent to enroll him in his treatment. Set for sentencing after treatment is completed. 1:22

02:39 PM Defendant Leander Jovon Gregg in Court pro se.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim present. Defendant would like to have an attorney, believes he qualifies for PD.  ADA Walker advises victim has been present at every hearing and wishes to make a statement.  Court reschedules Sentencing Hearing, advises he needs to contact PD immediately.  States if he fails to do so Court would have to consider if that is a waiver. 02:05 PM Defendant Leander Jovon Gregg in custody, in Court with Attorney T. Gregory Amann.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Walker notes joint recommendation, advises of Amended Information.  Defendant pleading to Count Three, DJOC.  Plead to Counts 4-5, recommending two years Probation court costs of $886, and 30 days jail w/credit for time served.  ADA Walker notes Count One was previously dismissed.  Moves to Dismiss Count Two.  Atty. Amann and Defendant confirm agreement.  Court notes victim present, review of VIS.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the Court; Court reviews with Defendant.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  Atty. Amann stipulates to facts.  Defendant pleads Guilty to amended Count Three.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds Defendant Guilty but defers entry of conviction pursuant to pending approval of DJOC.  Court questions Defendant as to Count Four.  Atty. Amann stipulates to facts.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count Four.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count Four and adjudicates.  Court questions Defendant as to Count Five.  Atty. Amann stipulates to facts.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count Five.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count Five and adjudicates.  Count Two dismissed.  ADA Walker makes statement.  Atty. Amann makes statement.  Defendant makes statement.  Court address Defendant.  Court approves DJOC as to Count Three.  Court sentences Defendant, withheld.  Court orders two years Probation on Counts Four and Five, concurrent.  Conditions to be set by Agent.  Court costs of $443 on each count.  30 days jail w/credit for time served.  Court advises of appeal rights.  Adjourned at 2:35 PM
Ashley Blodgett
Ashley Blodgett
